fields.description:
h2.Summary

Currently a few webhook events like  comment_updated, comment_deleted, worklog_created ...etc doesn't return the issue key to the user. While you can use ${issue.key} and similar variables to get the information, it is strange that such vital information is left out from the JSON payload. It will be useful for users to be able to directly query for such information directly from the JSON payload instead.
fields.summary: Event webhook like ''comment_created' should also include issue key

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results
The integration should keep the customer's choice saved and disable issue previews.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing a Cloud to Cloud import, it fails to inform that the sysadmin account does not have a valid email.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.1092.1

h3. Error
{noformat}
E-mail 'sysadmin@localhost' is not valid. User(s) using this email: 'sysadmin' 
{noformat}

3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a Cloud site
# Import to JIRA Cloud
# Import Fails with the message {noformat}E-mail 'sysadmin@localhost' is not valid. User(s) using this email: 'sysadmin' {noformat} !Screen Shot 2017-06-30 at 18.17.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The import succeeds.

h3. Actual Results
* JIRA Fails to import.

h3.Workaround
# Uncompress the backup file
# Edit the entities.xml 
# Locate the sysadmin@localhost entry {noformat}  <User id="xxxx" directoryId="1" userName="sysadmin" lowerUserName="sysadmin" active="1" createdDate="2017-xx-xx xx:xx:xx" updatedDate="2017-xx-xx xx:xx:xx.xxx" firstName="System" lowerFirstName="system" lastName="Administrator" lowerLastName="administrator" displayName="System Administrator" lowerDisplayName="system administrator" emailAddress="sysadmin@localhost" lowerEmailAddress="sysadmin@localhost.com" credential="{PKCS5S2}R+BJAdk3nuzFdPM7xgH9f6dp1SvPCTa57Z4LZvMj4kKcpcBvOBoBsW5rMs/xoydN"/>
    <UserAssociation sourceName="admin" sinkNodeId="10000" sinkNodeEntity="Issue" associationType="WatchIssue"/>{noformat}
# Add the .com entry, than the email will be looking like *sysadmin@localhost.com* 
{noformat}  <User id="xxxx" directoryId="1" userName="sysadmin" lowerUserName="sysadmin" active="1" createdDate="2017-xx-xx xx:xx:xx" updatedDate="2017-xx-xx xx:xx:xx.xxx" firstName="System" lowerFirstName="system" lastName="Administrator" lowerLastName="administrator" displayName="System Administrator" lowerDisplayName="system administrator" emailAddress="sysadmin@localhost.com" lowerEmailAddress="sysadmin@localhost.com" credential="{PKCS5S2}R+BJAdk3nuzFdPM7xgH9f6dp1SvPCTa57Z4LZvMj4kKcpcBvOBoBsW5rMs/xoydN"/>
    <UserAssociation sourceName="admin" sinkNodeId="10000" sinkNodeEntity="Issue" associationType="WatchIssue"/>{noformat}
# Save the File 
# Compress the folder with the XML + attachments file
# Perform the import again.
fields.summary: Import Fails because E-mail 'sysadmin@localhost' is not valid

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When configuring a screen fields (print below). JIRA automatically save these changes for each setting you change.


h3. Suggested Solution
Implement  "Save" / "Discard" buttons so that configurations can be undone if necessary.

h3. Why this is important
This can be bad for someone that is just testing the configuration, as you might lose it if you remove a field, and can't recall which was that. Changes are not reversible
 
h3. Workaround 
Take a screenshot before doing anything in that screen
fields.summary: Screen for configuring the screen fields should not auto commit changes

fields.description:
The JIRA Cloud Slack bot is pretty great. I have it configured to send messages to me in a private chat. The problem is it sends me notifications about things that I've done. Kind of pointless - I obviously know I've already done them.

It would be nice if it were possible to configure the events it sends messages for, to exclude certain users and types of update.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud Slack bot should be configurable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to Manage Sprint for user that has *Schedule Issues* permission based on Project Lead 

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Project 
# Edit the permission scheme to give *Schedule Issues* permission to Project Lead
# Make sure that the user also has *Manage Sprint* and *Edit issue* permission as noted in [Managing project permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Managing+project+permissions]

h3. Expected Results
A user with "Schedule Issues" permission should be able to Manage Sprints (move issues from *Backlog* to *Sprint*). 

h3. Actual Results
The user with "Schedule Issues" permission is not able to Manage Sprints 
*  !Screen Shot 2017-07-03 at 15.10.08.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Grant *Schedule Issues* permission to the user through different options (Group or a Role for example)
fields.summary: "Schedule Issues" permission do not work for Project Lead

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the JIRA Cloud site backup zip file, "Attachments" folder is stored inside "\data" folder instead of "data" folder. Therefore the attachments can't be imported when performing site import

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a site backup from JIRA Cloud
# Open the Zip file using "WinRAR"

h3. Expected Results
# There is a "data" folder

h3. Actual Results
# If there is an avatars folder, there will be 2 folders:
#* "\data" containing "attachments" folder
#* "data" containing "avatars" folder
# If there is no avatars folder, there will be 1 folder:
#* "\data" containing "attachmetns" folder

h3.Workaround
If you extract the zip file, the "/data" folder will be extracted as "data"; and it will merge with the other "data" folders as well (in case there is "avatars" folder). Therefore, if you want to perform an import to another site, you will have to extract the zip file, and then re-zip the contents again.
fields.summary: Attachments folder is stored inside "\data" directory instead of "data" for JIRA Cloud Site Backup

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In certain cases, you might want to search for all issues with or without parent tasks.
This can only be achieved with a third-party add-on like JQL Tricks in JIRA Server, with the function {{hasSubTasks()}}

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a JQL to search similar to hasSubTasks() for JIRA Cloud. Currently, the field 'subtasks' is not searchable, it is only sortable.

h3. Why this is important
Certain customers need to find all the issues without parent tasks for tracking purposes.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: JQL to filter issues with/without subtasks

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Automatic update of Tempo Timesheet Connect add-on to version *1.1.39-AC* fails in ~20% of cases. This triggers rollback to a previous installed version (<=1.1.39), but rollback fails resulting in add-on being disabled on the instance.

Live status updates here: http://status.atlassian.com/incidents/x60psg9bzzn3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# No specific steps - Connect add-ons are updated automatically in case if new version is available, and there are no changes to add-on permissions
# Every JIRA Cloud instance using Tempo Timesheet Connect is affected (pay attention to *-AC* in the add-on's version)

h3. Expected Results
# Add-on is updated successfully
# Or, add-on remains on the previous version in case if it fails to update

h3. Actual Results
# Add-on update fails
# Add-on revert fails

h3. Notes
Team working on this problem:
* Plans to re-enable Tempo Timesheet for all affected customers
* Investigates rollback failures to ensure this problem is not going to affect more customers

h3.Workaround
* on majority of instances it's possible to re-enable Tempo Timesheet add-on by following these steps:
** Navigate to Administration -> Add-ons -> Manage add-ons
** Find Tempo Timesheet in the list
** Expand add-on details, hit *Update* button
* if that doesn't work - navigate to [https://<JIRA_instance_URL>/admin/accessconfig], and confirm there are no pending actions on group access
fields.summary: Tempo Timesheet add-on update failure resulting in add-on being disabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Paragraph quote in "Style" dropdown list of JIRA description or comments editor for single line text is too confusing
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View any issue in Detail View
# Try to edit description of the issue or add a comment
# Choose 'Paragraph quote' from Style dropdown list
 !Paragraph Quote.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Paragraph can have multiple lines in it. So ideally this should insert below markdown to insert multiple lines.
{noformat}
{quote}quoted text{quote}
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
Paragraph quote inserts a 'bq.' markdown tag which is meant for a single line of text.
 !bq.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Use _Block quote_ for multiple lines.

See [Text Formatting Notation Help|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=texteffects] for more information.
fields.summary: Paragraph quote style for single line text is too confusing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The behavior of the ‘G+I’ shortcut has changed in JIRA Cloud. This is the change:
# Original behaviour: when we used this shortcut, it redirected us to our last JQL query under ‘/issues’ (we could see the last JQL query we searched). The JQL query changed depending on our last search
#* This is still the behavior in jira.atlassian.com and used to be the behavior in Cloud
# Current behavior: JIRA is currently _always_ showing this query:
{code}ORDER BY lastViewed DESC{code}
#* This shows the last viewed issues.
#* It’s important to point out that showing the last viewed issues is not the same as showing the last searched query


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the shortcut G+I
# Verify which screen you'll be redirected
# Depending on your JIRA version, you will see the *last search* page or the *search in history JQL* page

h3. Expected Results
The behavior should be consistent between JIRA instances or this is an indicative that the feature has changed or a BUG is ongoing. 

h3. Actual Results
Depending on the JIRA version of the instance, different behaviors are going to be noticed. 

h3. Notes 
There's no specific documentation for JIRA Cloud explaining the shortcut behaviors.
fields.summary: The behavior of the G+I shortcut has changed on latest releases

fields.description:
h3. *Steps to reproduce:*
 * Create a software project
 * Configure a Project Lead for the project
 * In the Permission Scheme, add the project lead to the permission *Schedule Issues***
 * Create a Scrum board with some issues in the backlog
 * In the bottom issue of the backlog, perform right click and try to move it to the top
 * Try to move the order of any issue in the backlog

h3. *Expected Behavior:*

The Project lead should be able to order the issues in the backlog.

 
h3. *Current Behavior:*

The project lead receives an error message: "You cannot perform this operation because you do not have "Schedule" permission."

 
h3. *Workaround:*

Grant the permission to the user that is the project lead as *single user* in the permission *Schedule issues*.
fields.summary: adding the project lead to the Schedule issue permission doesn't work

h3. Problem Definition
While in JIRA Mobile, the app does not have the capability (like in the browser) to show screens that are assigned to workflow transitions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide transition specific screens


h3. Why this is important
 This can cause (depending your workflow configuration) unwanted situations like issue transitioned without having resolution set when requested. And have a complete system like on the PC
 
h3. Workaround 
Insert a validator (see [Advanced Workflow Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html]) for the field you want not to be empty, this will at least avoid inconsistencies like the issue transition without value on the field
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile - Provide transition specific screens.

fields.description:
When a ticket number is included in a Jira text field (comment, description, etc.) it is modified to be a dynamic link to that ticket, with a note of that ticket's current status.

This is wonderful, don't change it, except:

This should _not_ be done when you mention the Jira ticket number _in that same ticket_. Doing that adds nothing of value, and in fact causes some unwelcome mangling of comment content in some cases.

To illustrate:
1. create a Jira ticket (assume it gets ID "FNORD-1234")
2. create a file whose name starts with that ticket ID, e.g. FNORD-1234.trace20170620.log
3. attach that file to the ticket
4. mention that filename in comment text (without markup)
5. the display of the filename will be corrupted by the automatic ticket reference linkification process.
fields.summary: Jira ticket numbers in comments should not be interpreted specially for the current issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you zoom in using the touchpad, there is a grey/white bar blocking the view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any project or issue in JIRA.
 # Zoom in using the touchpad (pinch to zoom)

h3. Expected Results
 - The screen is zoomed correctly.

!Screen Shot 2017-06-27 at 1.14.23 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
 - The more you zoom in, larger is the grey/white bar blocking the screen. See the comparison below.
 !normal.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Default mail handler (Comments from emails) interfere with the other mail handler causing an email from anonymous (non JIRA user) is not being added as a comment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # By default, there will be one mail server and one mail handler
 # Create another mail handler (ie. New issue/Comment) and set a default reporter (make sure the reporter has *Create Issue* permission)
 # Send a test email from anonymous (non JIRA user) with a subject of any existing issue (ie. ABC-1)

h3. Actual Result

An email is not being added as a comment and only marked as read by the default mail handler as it doesn't have a default reporter.
h3. Expected Result

An email should be added as a comment.
h3. Suggestions
 # Make UX so that user feel safe to delete the default handler and replace with their custom one
 # Allow define the order in which handlers will process the mail
 # When there are several handlers, a handler will not mark the email as read unless it can process or the last one
fields.summary: Improvements to default incoming mail handler

fields.description:
Similar to what would be a burn-up chart, it would be valuable to be able to configure the cumulative flow diagram to show each status overlaped instead of stacked. 

 

So for any given period of time we could compare how far is testing from development. 

In such way, the progress of every stage of the workflow is shown perfectly clean without being distorted by previous stage.
fields.summary: Allow Cumulative Flow Diagram to show status overlaped instead of stacked

fields.description:
It would be great if we could group certain values together in both the x and  y axis of two dimensional statistics gadget. 

Grouping could be performed on math comparisons, such as min-max thresholds, or giving a name to certain group of values (similar to what is done with statusCategory). 

I.e, "Unresolved" as a list of in progress, ready to test, ready to deploy, etc, statuses, and "resolved" for "resolved" and "closed" statuses
fields.summary: Add grouping to two dimensional gadget

fields.description:
In our instance of JIRA cloud, we would like to have the ability to create nested queries that can assist our instance in creating more complex searches and dashboards.

Please let me know there is a plan to execute such a request.

Example:  Epic Link in ( *Saved Filter...*) - bring all epic links from a saved filter.

thanks.

Bowen Chow
fields.summary: Ability to create nested queries in Jira Cloud

fields.description: After selecting "log work" from the ellipses "..." button and completing this workflow, a notification is displayed that blocks subsequent entries using this button. Please move this notification out of the way, maybe bottom right instead of top right hiding this button.
fields.summary: "toast" notification blocks issue action buttons in new UI design.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Long running tasks are having issues when another long running task is triggered by the same time.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Checked within JIRA Core Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start one of these actions:
#* Bulk operation *(any kind)
#* Clone issue
#* Background Indexing
#* Workflow migration
# Now trigger another any of these actions *while the previous task is still running*:
#* Bulk operation *(any kind)
#* Clone issue
#* Background Indexing
#* Workflow migration

h3. Expected Results
Tasks to run successfully.

h3. Actual Results
You'll see a generic error like this one:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
{code}"The task context is not of the expected type. Expected 'com.atlassian.jira.config.IndexTaskContext' but got 'com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.clone.CloneIssueTaskManagerImpl$CloneIssueTaskContext'"{code}
Where the "expected" value changes according to what tasks you run. *Both tasks fail*

 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Assure that no tasks will be run simultaneously.
fields.summary: JIRA Long running tasks can not run simultaneously

fields.description: When a site import has just been performed to JIRA, most of the time the instance's performance will be reduced temporarily until the instance has stabilized. It'd be a good idea to display a banner for example: "Reindexing Tasks, System might be slow" or other relevant messages to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Provide a notification or banner to notify users for possible temporary slowness after import

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to use Bulk operations on issues from issue search dialog, if used named filter (my open issues, reported by me, etc), "Bulk change" menu item triggers JIRA page to redirect to {{JIRA_URL/issues/?filter=-1}}. If used custom search, said menu item works fine.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA
# Navigate to Dashboard page
# In top menu click "Issues" > "My opened issues"
# In the Ellipsis (...) menu click "Bulk change all ... issues" menu item

h3. Expected Results
# JIRA redirects to "Bulk issue change" page

h3. Actual Results
# JIRA redirects to {{JIRA_URL/issues/?filter=-1}}, which is effectively "My opened issues" page.
 
h3.Workaround
# Navigate to the page that was opened after last step of "Steps to Reproduce" section
# In the list of filtered fields add another field (but do not change it's default value - should stay "All")
# Click the search button
# You will observe that URL of the page changed to some long form.
# Click ellipsis button and select "Bulk change all ... issues" once again, and it will work.
fields.summary: "Bulk change" menu item doesn't work when searching issues by named filter

fields.description:
*Problem Statement*

The triangle drop-down color is not editable through Look and Feel (see dropdown in white colour)

 !test.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggestion:* 

The drop down colour should follow the Header Text Colour or make the colour configurable through separate component.
fields.summary: The drop down color cannot be changed through the look and feel.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempt to transition an issue, 'Could not load FunctionProvider class' is showing if 'Notify Zendesk Ticket' post function is used while *Salesforce & JIRA Cloud Connector* is disabled/uninstalled.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.1085.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install *Zendesk Support for JIRA* and *Salesforce & JIRA Cloud Connector*
# Add *Notify Zendesk Ticket* post function to a transition, then *Publish Draft*
# Disable *Salesforce & JIRA Cloud Connector*
# Attempt to make the transition on Step 2

h3. Expected Results
Transition is made without any issue.

h3. Actual Results
Error message is thrown:
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* The post function works fine without *Salesforce & JIRA Cloud Connector* install ever

h3.Workaround
Unsubscribe *Salesforce & JIRA Cloud Connector*, then keep it enabled. No changes on the add-on as the add-on is unsubscribe.
fields.summary: 'Notify Zendesk Ticket' post function is broken if Salesforce & JIRA Cloud Connector is disabled

fields.description: As an administrator, I want to be able to turn off boards then for business projects
fields.summary: Turn off boards then for business projects

fields.description:
The option *Share this issue by emailing other users* give you the possibility to send e-mails containing the *Issue Id* and the *Summary* to users not allowed to access the issue in the Permission Scheme.

Can we have a feature to restrict only users able to access the issue to receive the e-mail? It would be great to avoid security issues since the *Summary* field can contain restricted information.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Sharing option on issue view display users not able to see issues

fields.description:
Being able to have the transitions represented by different colored lined on the workflow designer would help users to be able to categorize transitions when they perform different functions.

For example, I'm setting up a workflow where certain transitions to Closed send notifications to a particular group and other transitions to Closed send no transitions. It would be helpful if I could distinguish them from each other with a visual indicator.

My scenario is only one case where this would be useful. I'm NOT asking for the colors to be reactive to a specific setting or condition. It would be an arbitrary/user selection just for the sake of helping to distinguish details of the workflow at a glance.
fields.summary: Ability to Change Transition Color on Workflow Designer

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If user_key column in app_user table contains leading whitespace, that user cannot be added into project role
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update the app_user table to update user_key column to have the leading whitespace.
 For example: ( john.smith) - Notice that there is a whitespace in front of john.smith
 # Go to Project Settings
 # Go to Users and Roles
 # Click Add Users to a Role
 # Find the user john.smith, select any roles, and click on Add button

h3. Expected Results

The user john.smith will be added to project role successfully
h3. Actual Results

There will be error message thrown 'We can't find 'john.smith' in any accessible user directory. Check they're still active and available and try again.
fields.summary: Unable to add user to a project role if there is a leading whitespace in the user_key column in app_user table

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Webhook automatically truncates '=' characters found in the URLs.

h3.Step to Replicate

# Create a webhook. 
# Under URL put 'http://requestb.in?code=K2MlC9p9gJ51XEg6BPvwtmXzZAnc0UFTwVgTWGvmIMB2ZpYntYxETA=='
# Trigger the webhook on any issue creation in the Cloud instance

h3.Expected Results

Webhook request should be sent to the URL without changes.

h3.Current Results

Webhook request is sent to 'http://requestb.in?code=K2MlC9p9gJ51XEg6BPvwtmXzZAnc0UFTwVgTWGvmIMB2ZpYntYxETA' . The '==' at the end is gone if you noticed.

h3.Workaround

Generate a new URL without the '==' at the end.
fields.summary: Webhook truncates '=' characters in URL parameters

fields.description:
Several times, I have been midway through writing a long JIRA issue description and have hit the escape key on my keyboard by accident, or by some twitch of muscle memory when my brain is fried from programming.

This results in the loss of focus from the description edit window, which causes me to lose any progress I made when writing the description. A simply "Are you sure you want to lose your modifications?" message would alleviate a lot of this frustration.

 

Thanks, also, I'm not sure if this suggestion is in the right location or set to the correct component. Apologies if that is the case.
fields.summary: Confirmation when hitting "Esc" key while modifying an issue description

fields.description:
As an admin users would like the ability to have a Confluence space created for the JIRA project they're creating automatically. This was a feature in the past which users have become accustomed to using and the removal has caused them to modify their workflow.

 

This functionality was confirmed to have been removed by the JIRA project manager in JIRACLOUD-65134 and this feature request is being opened to ask it's brought back.
fields.summary: Bring back option to create linked Confluence space when creating JIRA project

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Newer Cloud instance on the new platform no longer shows SMTP mail details. Only an empty page. User can still toggle on and off for the outgoing mail but it is ugly and redundant as the outgoing mail page is now just an empty white page.
fields.summary: Outgoing mail page in JIRA Cloud now just shows an empty white page

fields.description:

JIRA backup (both server and cloud) currently doesn't contain user encryption method value. This doesn't cause major problems during the import process of a Cloud backup into JIRA Server but after the import is completed, user will not be able to access even when using the correct sysadmin credential.

h3.Expected Result

When checking the entities.xml this should be the expected result.

{noformat}
    <Directory id="1" directoryName="JIRA Internal Directory" lowerDirectoryName="jira internal directory" createdDate="2013-02-28 11:57:51.308" updatedDate="2016-07-13 15:30:41.195" active="1" description="JIRA default internal directory" implementationClass="com.atlassian.crowd.directory.InternalDirectory" lowerImplementationClass="com.atlassian.crowd.directory.internaldirectory" type="INTERNAL" position="0"/>
    <DirectoryAttribute directoryId="1" name="user_encryption_method" value="atlassian-security"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_GROUP"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="DELETE_USER"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="CREATE_GROUP"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_USER"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_USER_ATTRIBUTE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_ROLE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="CREATE_USER"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="CREATE_ROLE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_GROUP_ATTRIBUTE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="DELETE_GROUP"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="DELETE_ROLE"/>
{noformat}

h3.Current Results

Currently newly generated backups from new JIRA instances doesn't have the user encryption method value.

{noformat}
    <Directory id="1" directoryName="JIRA Internal Directory" lowerDirectoryName="jira internal directory" createdDate="2015-10-19 11:48:18.871" updatedDate="2017-05-16 06:19:07.323" active="1" description="JIRA default internal directory" implementationClass="com.atlassian.crowd.directory.InternalDirectory" lowerImplementationClass="com.atlassian.crowd.directory.internaldirectory" type="INTERNAL" position="0"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_USER"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="DELETE_USER"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_GROUP_ATTRIBUTE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_ROLE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="CREATE_USER"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="DELETE_ROLE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="UPDATE_USER_ATTRIBUTE"/>
    <DirectoryOperation directoryId="1" operationType="CREATE_GROUP"/>

fields.description:
I would like to be able to drag and drop backlog items between browser windows.
This would be useful if you have a large backlog and want to change the rank (position) of items. It would negate the need to scroll down very slowly after starting to drag an item.

This should be possible to implement using the HTML5 Drag and Drop API.

*Usage example*
Open a second browser window with the same project backlog, but scrolled further down, drag items from the first browser window to the second one.
fields.summary: Drag and drop backlog items between browser windows to change rank

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Issue Transition notification is not being received in Slack if *Assigned Updated* checkbox is not checked and the transition have an auto assign issue post function.


h2. Steps to reproduce
# In Slack channel, type in {{/jira connect <instanceURL>}}
# Click on Edit
# Uncheck the assigned update checkbox
# Go to project settings
# Go to workflow and add an auto assign issue post function in one of the transition.
# Click on publish
# Create Issue
# Perform the transition that has the auto assign post function.


h2. Expected
Receive slack Notification

h2.  Result
No Slack Notification triggered.

h2. Workaround
Tick the Assigned Update checkbox
fields.summary: Unable to receive Slack notification for issue transition if Assignee Update checkbox is unchecked and you have an auto assign post function for the transtion

fields.description:
When creating an issue in the desktop software we do not use the Description field and have replaced it with a custom field. The Description field is disabled and hidden in the desktop software.

When creating an issue from the mobile app, the Description field is visible. Since it is disabled in the desktop layout, if a mobile user so much as clicks in the description field they cannot complete creating the ticket. The following error is received when trying to create an issue after editing the description field: "Field 'description' cannon be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown."

We need to be able to edit the mobile app layout to remove the Description field and change the order of how the fields show on the screen.
fields.summary: Ability to change layout in JIRA Mobile app. Create issue screen.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when the plugin between Slack and JIRA is installed, it becomes a System plugin and can't be uninstalled since there's no option available on the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the *Slack for JIRA* plugin
# Navigate to the instance's add-on page - path: plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace
# There's no button to uninstall the add-on, the only option available is *Manage*

h3. Expected Results
The uninstall option should be available and listed on the UI.

h3. Actual Results
There's only the option to *manage* the add-on. When clicking on this option, JIRA redirects the user to a list with all *System add-ons*, but no option to remove the add-on is available.

h3. Workaround
To make sure that no link between a Slack channel and a JIRA project is still in use (user must be an administrator in JIRA and Slack):
* Access a project which is linked to Slack
* Access its *Project Settings*
* On the left panel, select *Slack Integration*
* Click on the *Delete* button to remove the link between the project and the Slack channel
* Perform the same procedure on all linked projects
fields.summary: Make it possible to completely uninstall/remove the Slack for JIRA plugin

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Suite Utilities for JIRA and the *Time spent in source* status in transition tab behaves erratically at times.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Not all issues seem to behave the same way
# Go to the Transitions tab of an issue and compare the timestamps of the transitions to the timestamps on the HIstory tab. Sometimes the times will behave oddly and the Time Spent in Source timestamps will not make sense when compared to the HIstory tab.

h3. Expected Results
# There should be a clear relationship between the transitions times in the History tab and those in the Transitions tab.

h3. Actual Results
The times do not make sense at times.  

!transition.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This is a public facing bug for the investigation being done at [JCE-1172|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JCE-1172]
fields.summary: Suite Utilities for JIRA - Time spent in source status in transition tab behaves erratically at times

fields.description: We currently have Asana external JIRA Import. During the import, JIRA will automatically send the invitation email to the user that listed in Asana. It will be great if we could have an option to not send invitation email to the user during Asana import.
fields.summary: It will be great if we could have an option to not send invitation email to the user during Asana import

fields.description:
Hi,

I regularly have to create new projects in our JIRA cloud  environment. When doing so I re-use the configuration of previous projects in order to have the new project set up the exact same way. Unfortunately the settings of the linked users in the different roles will not be copied to the new project.

I understood that it's possible to change the default project users on system level, however there are multiple project managers using the same system. They don't need the same setup as my projects.

See also: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions/Set-default-quot-Users-and-roles-quot-for-new-project/qaq-p/600094#M52282]

It would be great if it was possible to easily copy these settings, setup a personal default or setup a default based on specific project attributes (e.g. project category).

 

Kind regards,

 

Lars Anderson

Credit Tools
fields.summary: Default users and roles when creating new project

fields.description:
h3. Atlassian Update:
The functionality has been disabled to prevent sites from changing the email address while the sites transition to new email servers.
The functionality will be available in a couple of weeks with additional checks to verify that the domain is valid and DKIM/SPF records are in place to use an external domain.

Find more details in https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html

h3. Summary
The project email address setting is not visible and it prevents users from changing the default jira@instancename.atlassian.net email to a custom email and vice versa.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to cogwheel > *Projects* > select any project
# Click on *Notifications*
# Observe that the default email notification setting is not visible:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behavior
Users should able to edit the default email notification setting:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual behavior
Default email notification setting is not visible
fields.summary: Project email address setting is not visible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
We have detected some instances are down and we are currently working on it already.
fields.summary: Several Instances Down

fields.description:
Hi,

In our enterprise we use JAMF Casper Suite to deploy and provision IOS devices globally.
We have many users and which to provision as much as possible for these devices.


We would very much like it if the JIRA app would be have support for the AppConfig framework which has been created by the MDM (Mobile Device Mangement) community (Microsoft, IBM Maass360, JAMF, MobileIron, VMware Airwatch, Blackberry, Cisco, SAP).

In doing so we would like Single Sign-On provisioning and remote-app delete possablity.
Is there any timeline for JIRA Cloud of Confluence Cloud to implemnement this?

 

AppConfig does Android and IOS app provision

The Microsoft Office 365 Apps, Box.com, Dropbox, Tableaun DocuSign are a few who are already on board.

https://www.appconfig.org

[https://www.petervanderwoude.nl/post/microsoft-intune-and-the-appconfig-community/]

Hope to hear from you.

Regards, Rick
fields.summary: Adding AppConfig template to Android/IOS software for auto App provisioning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Certain Excel *.xlsx* files cannot be uploaded while AdBlock is enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *.xlsx* file
# Have a browser with AdBlock extension installed.

h3. Expected Results
- The file is uploaded successfully.
 !Screen Shot 2017-06-20 at 4.52.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
- You get the following error while trying to upload the file: 
  !Screen Shot 2017-06-20 at 4.48.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

{code}File <filename> was not uploaded. An internal error has occurred. Please contact your administrator.{code}
- On console you will get the following error:
{code}
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_BLOCKED_BY_CLIENT
{code}
 
h3. Notes
- This problem is intermittent - it is not occurring with every *.xlsx* file.

h3.Workaround
- Disable AdBlock to upload the desired file.
fields.summary: Certain Excel (.xlsx) files cannot be uploaded while AdBlock is enabled.

h3. Summary
When [new interface is enabled on Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], it shows "No Confluence page found with the given URL." when attempting to link JIRA issue with Confluence pages or blog posts.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.1074.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Make sure Confluence has new interface enabled*
# Create a blog post on Confluence
# Go to any JIRA issue
# Attempt to link the blog post to JIRA issue

h3. Expected Results
Link to Confluence blog is added to the issue.

h3. Actual Results
It shows "No Confluence page found with the given URL."
!screenshot1..jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* For Confluence pages, this only happens when the Confluence Page contains special characters or the URL contains page ID
* No error found from the logs or browser's Development tools

fields.description:
Requiring Smart Commits to be specified in the commit subject makes for really painful commit logs, especially for public projects - the shortlog is basically useless since it must contain opaque, low-value command-text in the most important part of the commit.

Parsing Smart Commits from the commit body (requiring them to be on a newline is fine) would make commits much less ugly, and more informative.
fields.summary: Smart Commits should be parsed from commit message body

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Companies may have sensitive information in their JIRA site that watchers or request participants of an issue will receive via email when there is a change done on the issue. This is fine if the recipient server supports TLS because the on-demand cloud e-mail senders now support TLS, but this is a negotiated protocol, and if a non-TLS e-mail recipient is watching a JIRA issue the confidential content will be broadcast over the internet in a non-secure fashion.

h3. Suggested Solution

The ability to change the outbound e-mail feature from "request" to "require" TLS on a project-by-project or issue-by-issue basis such that sensitive information can still be accessed by an individual with an e-mail pointing to a mail host that does not support TLS (which is a relatively small proportion of the internet population these days), but if that individual watches an issue, they will not receive the notification because the e-mail sending action will "require" the receiving mail exchange to support TLS. Since TLS is not supported, the mail sending action will then fail, and not broadcast the content un-encrypted.
fields.summary: Have the option to enable 'TLS required' email notifications in JIRA

fields.description: While browsing issues in the backlog, it would be useful to have the "Time Tracking" field the same way they are displayed on the Issues screen. Currently, in other to see the Estimated, the Remaining, and the Logged times in a graphical way, you have to go to the issue itself. Please see the attached screenshot for more info. Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: The "Time Tracking" field is visible on the Issues screen but not visible on the Backlog screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

*Affected version: (not available in field): 1000.1068.0*

JSON import allows you to import, among other data, issue history. However, it allows you to add issue history in a wrong format and after import it completely breaks the issue.

We could see at least two problems:
# History with a null 'toString' and 'fromString'
# History with null 'fieldType'

An example below for problem 1 (complete file available: [^problem1.json]):
{code}
"history": [
                        {
				"items": [
                                	{   
                                    	"field": "assignee",
                                    	"toString": null, 
                                    	"fieldType": "jira",
                                    	"fromString": null
                                	}
                            	],
                            	"created": "2005-09-28T19:09:19Z",
                            	"author": "unknown"
                        }
]
{code}

We can see that 'toString' and 'fromString' are both null. This is not accepted in JIRA, but JSON import accepts it and the issue is imported/created but it contains a broken issue history. 

When accessing the issue, we can see this error in logs (an a pop-up window appears saying the issue has problems):
{code}
2017-06-19 13:40:14.619705500 java.lang.IllegalStateException: You cannot create a change item without either a 'from' or 'to' value.
2017-06-19 13:40:14.619706500 	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean$Builder.build(ChangeItemBean.java:327)
2017-06-19 13:40:14.619747500 	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.DefaultChangeHistoryManager.lambda$getChangeItemsForField$0(DefaultChangeHistoryManager.java:218)
2017-06-19 13:40:14.619748500 	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
2017-06-19 13:40:14.619748500 	at java.util.Iterator.forEachRemaining(Iterator.java:116)
2017-06-19 13:40:14.619748500 	at java.util.Spliterators$IteratorSpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:1801)
{code}

For problem 2:
{code}
 		    "history": [
                        {
				"items": [
                                	{   
                                    	"field": "assignee",
                                    	"toString": "unknown", 
                                    	"fieldType": null,
                                    	"fromString": null
                                	}
                            	],
                            	"created": "2005-09-28T19:09:19Z",
                            	"author": "unknown"
                        }
			]

{code}

Again, it's imported and when accessing it, we get this error (complete file available: [^problem2.json]), again a message saying 'There were errors loading the issue.' in UI and sometimes we can't even open the issue:
{code}
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057859500 2017-06-19 13:48:17,050 http-nio-3003-exec-8 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/].[action]] Servlet.service() for servlet [action] in context with path [] threw exception [java.lang.IllegalStateException: You cannot create a change item without a field type.] with root cause
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057862500 java.lang.IllegalStateException: You cannot create a change item without a field type.
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057863500 	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean$Builder.build(ChangeItemBean.java:324)
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057896500 	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.DefaultChangeHistoryManager.lambda$getChangeItemsForField$0(DefaultChangeHistoryManager.java:218)
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057897500 	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057898500 	at java.util.Iterator.forEachRemaining(Iterator.java:116)
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057898500 	at java.util.Spliterators$IteratorSpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:1801)
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057905500 	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057905500 	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057906500 	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
2017-06-19 13:48:17.057913500 	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import JSON [^problem1.json] or [^problem2.json]
# Access issue created

h3. Expected Results
* Issues are created without error
* History items are correct

h3. Actual Results
* Issues are created with broken history
* We can see the errors in logs
 
h3.Workaround
None so far
fields.summary: Json import may break issue history

fields.description:
h2. Problem Statement
When creating a new project via Create with Shared Configurations fails, the error message does not indicate why the project creation failed. The only error message shown is {{Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again.}}.

h2. Suggested solution
It would be great if JIRA could provide a more informative error message on the UI. Without this information, the administrator cannot understand why the project creation failed or take steps to rectify the situation.
fields.summary: Error when creating new project via Create with Shared Configurations should be informative

fields.description:
When Webhooks are not successfully sent, error messages should be stored on the logs, so that it is possible to keep track of the data lost and find what caused it to fail.

Currently, it is not possible for users to check the logs on these operations, which is another reason why this would be important.
fields.summary: Logs should store data from WebHooks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User created via REST API receives invitation email and need to click on the link to complete the account creation before the account can be used to execute other REST calls. This is mostly because of Atlassian Accounts, since newly created user account in JIRA Cloud will now lead to the creation of a user account in Atlassian ID which requires email confirmation to finish the user creation process.

While in documentation, it is stated that:
{quote}Create user. By default created user will not be notified with email. If password field is not set then password will be randomly generated.
{quote}
The documentation will need to be updated or there will need to be a new feature in the REST end point to enable/disable email confirmation during user creation.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create user using {{POST /rest/api/2/user}}.
 # Send the JSON payload including the password:
{noformat}
{
    "name": "charlie",
    "password": "abracadabra",
    "emailAddress": "charlie@atlassian.com",
    "displayName": "Charlie of Atlassian",
}
{noformat}

 # Check related mail inbox.

h3. Expected Result

User creation completed without receiving invitation email and the credential can be used to perform REST calls directly.
h3. Current Result

The credential can't be used to perform REST calls unless the link in invitation mail is followed.
h3. Notes

The new [experimental user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-api-3-user-post] endpoint {{POST /rest/api/3/user}} has the *notification* parameter that should allow the user to disable notifications on user creation.
This attribute is currently not working so all user creations will still trigger an email notification. 
We will use this bug to track the fix on that for now.
fields.summary: User created via REST API receives invitation email

h3. Environment

JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT (Vertigo)

1. Create a ticket with new component :-

!Screen Shot 2017-06-16 at 9.20.23 PM.png|width=410,height=277!

 This page display *"# TODO: This is probably unused. Remove. JDEV-38210"*
fields.summary: In Component page , there's hardcoded text "TODO: This is probably unused. Remove. JDEV-38210" . This should be remove.

fields.description:
h2. Summary 
In Edit Mode, the Time Tracking setting shows _Time Display Format_ as *Pretty* even though it is actually set to *Hours*

h2. Environment
JIRA v1000.1068.0

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Click *Edit global settings* in https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin.jspa
# Change _Time Display Format_ and _Unit_ to *Hours* and *Save*
# Refresh the page 
# Re-edit and observe that _Time Display Format_ and _Unit_ are changed to *Pretty* and *Minute*

h2. Expected result
_Time Display Format_ and _Unit_ remain in *Hours* in edit mode

h2. Actual result
_Time Display Format_ and _Unit_ are changed to *Pretty* and *Minute* in edit mode


h2. *Note*
Verified that this does not affect the issue worklogs format. The values still show in *Hours* format as per configured in step 2 above.
fields.summary: Time Tracking set for Hours shows as Pretty in edit mode

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# create an issue with this Summary: abc_def_123_ghi_jkl
# run this JQL: summary ~ abc
-> FOUND
# run this JQL: summary ~ def
-> NOT FOUND
# run this JQL: summary ~ ghi
-> NOT FOUND
# run this JQL: summary ~ jkl
-> FOUND

{panel}
(x) It looks like that, if a word contains a Text separated from a Number with an Underscore, searching for that specific Text does not work.
{panel}

{panel}
(/) Searching with a Text not separated from a Number with an Underscore, however, works.
{panel}
fields.summary: Strange behavior with Contains operator when Text is separated from Number with an Underscore

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The REST End point below is returning 'user failed to authenticate' error when used with basic authentication.

* https://<DOMAIN_NAME>.atlassian.net/admin/rest/um/1/user?username=<USERNAME>&expand=attributes 


h3.Steps to Replicate

Try running the REST End point via cURL. Use basic authentication.

{noformat}
curl -i -X GET -H "Authorization: Basic <BASE-64_USER_CREDS>"  -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<DOMAIN_NAME>.atlassian.net/admin/rest/um/1/user?username=<USERNAME>&expand=attributes

[8] 125
soramaru@SORAMARU-PC:~$ HTTP/1.1 401
Server: nginx
Date: Thu, 15 Jun 2017 09:40:00 GMT
Content-Type: text/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 27
Connection: keep-alive
IdPlat-Outstanding-Token: none
X-Application-Context: application:prod-east:8080
{noformat}

{noformat}
curl -i -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" -u username:password https://<DOMAIN_NAME>.atlassian.net/admin/rest/um/1/user?username=<USERNAME>&expand=attributes

HTTP/1.1 401
Server: nginx
Date: Thu, 15 Jun 2017 09:19:55 GMT
Content-Type: text/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 27
Connection: keep-alive
IdPlat-Outstanding-Token: none
X-Application-Context: application:prod-east:8080

User failed to authenticate
{noformat}

If you login via browser and run the same REST end point, it works and return data.


h3.Workaround

Use cookie authentication when using this REST end point, it will work.
fields.summary: Basic authentication failing for /admin/rest/um/1/user?username=<USERNAME>&expand=attributes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After migrating from Server to Cloud or from Cloud to Cloud, data was imported but all the imported users were set as inactive. In addition, some of the users don't exist at all and are missing in the User Management. They still appear in JIRA tho.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a JIRA import from Server to Cloud or from Cloud to Cloud

h3. Expected Results

Users and data are imported successfully.

h3. Actual Results

Import appears to be successful but in reality, all users set as inactive and some of them are missing.

h3. Workaround

To add the users manually with the same username after the import
fields.summary: Users missing and some users are set as inactive after import from JIRA Server / Cloud to JIRA Cloud

I'd like to be able to have recurring Service Desk request automatically created every week or based on any schedule

h3. Suggestion
Allow recurring Service Desk request to be created based on schedule
fields.summary: Auto create recurring request based on schedule

fields.description:
JSWSERVER-14565 is for JIRA Server
----
Currently in JIRA Cloud is isn't possible to change what appears in the 'Issues in Epic' panel in an epic screen.

The columns shown are the issue reference, issue summary, issue type and status.

I would like to be able to see other information in this screen, such as time tracking information (estimated & remaining) and other fields that can be filtered on
fields.summary: Add facility to change what is displayed in the 'Issues in Epic' panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA notifications are delayed

h3. Environment
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue, perform an action that should trigger a notification
# The user who should be notified will receive the message hours later

h3. Expected Results
Notification is sent right after the update

h3. Actual Results
There's a delay on notification. JIRA logs will show entries for the notification a few hours after the change.
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
* Contact Atlassian Support (https://getsupport.atlassian.com)
fields.summary: JIRA notifications are delayed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Remaining time is set to 0 if there is work logged before the issue was estimated. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure JIRA legacy mode is disabled in Time Tracking Configuration (this is set by default) 
# Create an issue
# Log work to an issue
# Add Original Estimation for the issue

h3. Expected Results
Remaining Time changes accordingly to the work logged

h3. Actual Results
Remaining Time is set to 0 when work is logged 
Remaining Time is not changed when estimation is edited 

h3. Notes
It is possible to manually edit the Remaining field to a specific value and further logged work will be extracted from this value. 

h3.Workaround
Estimate the issue first and then log work on it
fields.summary: Remaining time is always 0 if there is work logged before the issue was estimated

fields.description:

User seeing the following error when trying to create backup in JIRA

!Screen Shot 2017-06-14 at 4.32.34 PM.png!

Backups generated without attachments does not seem to be affected by this problem.
fields.summary: Unable to create Jira backup

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JQL searches are not working for Group Picker custom field when the value is not the default groups.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new group, eg: Group A
 # Create a Group Picker (single group) custom field, eg: Single Group
 # Create an issue with *Single Group = Group A*
 # Perform a search with {{"Single Group" = "Group A"}} or {{"Single Group" in ("Group A")}}

h3. Expected Results

The issues with Group A assigned will be shown
h3. Actual Results

JIRA shows "No issues were found to match your search"
h3. Notes
 * Results show when using {{"Single Group" is not EMPTY}}
 * The searches work when a default group is assigned, eg: jira-software-users, jira-servicedesk-agents, administrators, site-admins
 * When use {{"Single Group" in ("Group A")}}, the result is showing
fields.summary: Issue Searches Not Working for Group Picker for some instances

fields.description:
Summary

When transitioning an issue utilizing drag and drop in columns in Internet Explorer 11 the following error is displayed:

Something isn't letting us move xxxxxx-xx to In Progress. Ask your project administrator to check the workflow settings and transition conditions.
h3. Environment
 * Tested in cloud instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with a standard workflow
 # Go to Sprint and try to transition the issue from one status to another using drag and drop.

h3. Expected Results

Issue is transitioned.

Actual Results

An error is reported:
{code:java}
Something isn't letting us move xxxxxx-xx to In Progress. Ask your project administrator to check the workflow settings and transition conditions.
{code}
Workaround:

Use another browser or manually transition the issue.
fields.summary: Unable to transition issue utilizing drag and drop in Internet Explorer 11 IE 11

fields.description:

The issue does not happen with other e-mail clients.
